hotel.name: Hotel City Meridian
hotel.reasonForSelection: Excellent guest rating (4.6) from over 1400 reviews, falling well within the budget. It offers key amenities like Free Wi-Fi and is centrally located, providing good value.

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel City Meridian → Cubbon Park → Hotel City Meridian

places.name: Hotel Check-in & Relaxation
places.description: Arrive in Bengaluru, check into your hotel, and take some time to settle in after your journey from Delhi. Unpack and relax before heading out to explore the Garden City.
places.whyVisit: Essential downtime after traveling to ensure you are refreshed and ready for the exciting days ahead.

safetyNotes: Keep your luggage secure and valuables in the hotel safe.

places.name: Cubbon Park
places.description: A landmark 'lung' area of Bengaluru, Cubbon Park is a sprawling green oasis in the city's heart. It covers an area of 300 acres and is an ideal spot for a leisurely evening stroll, offering a tranquil escape from the urban hustle.
places.whyVisit: It's a beautiful, well-maintained park that provides a serene environment for relaxation and light recreation. It's perfect for families, with attractions like a playground and the Bangalore Aquarium located within its premises.

practicalInfo.entryFee: Free for park entry. Aquarium has a separate fee.

whatToBring: An umbrella or raincoat, as the forecast predicts a 73% chance of rain.
whatToBuy: Local snacks from vendors outside the park.
safetyNotes: Stay on well-lit paths as evening approaches.
photoSpots: In front of the State Central Library

places.name: Dinner at a Local Restaurant
places.description: Explore Bengaluru's diverse culinary landscape. The area around your hotel and Cubbon Park offers a variety of dining options, from traditional South Indian thalis to international cuisines, catering to all tastes and budgets.
places.whyVisit: To savor the authentic flavors of Karnataka and experience the city's vibrant food culture.
activities: Trying local dishes like Bisi Bele Bath or Akki Roti

safetyNotes: Check restaurant reviews online before visiting.

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel City Meridian → Visvesvaraya Industrial & Technological Museum → Bangalore Palace → ISKCON Temple Bangalore → Hotel City Meridian

places.name: Bangalore Palace
places.description: A majestic palace of the Tudor Revival style architecture, complete with fortified towers, battlements, and turrets. The interiors are adorned with elegant wood carvings, floral motifs, and paintings, offering a fascinating look into the life of the Wodeyar dynasty.
places.whyVisit: It provides a captivating glimpse into the splendor of one of India's most enduring royal families. The audio guide offers detailed stories about the palace's history and its famous residents.

practicalInfo.accessibility: Limited accessibility for wheelchairs in some sections.

whatToBring: An umbrella, as rain is likely (75% probability).
safetyNotes: Follow the designated routes within the palace.

places.name: Visvesvaraya Industrial & Technological Museum
places.description: An interactive science museum dedicated to the memory of Sir M. Visvesvaraya. It features various exhibition halls on themes like Engine Hall, Fun Science, Electrotechnic, and Space Gallery, making learning about science a fun and engaging experience.
places.whyVisit: Perfect for a 13-year-old, this museum offers numerous hands-on exhibits that simplify complex scientific principles. It's an educational and entertaining outing for the entire family.
activities: Exploring the Wright brothers' flyer replica

whatToBring: Curiosity and a willingness to interact with exhibits.
whatToBuy: Educational toys and kits from the museum shop.
photoSpots: With the giant dinosaur replica outside

places.name: ISKCON Temple Bangalore
places.description: One of the largest ISKCON temples in the world, this complex is a stunning blend of modern technology and traditional Dravidian and modern architecture. It is dedicated to Lord Krishna and provides a deeply spiritual and serene atmosphere.
places.whyVisit: The temple's grandeur, beautiful idols, and peaceful ambiance make it a must-visit. The evening aarti (prayer ceremony) is a particularly captivating experience.

practicalInfo.accessibility: Elevators are available for the elderly and disabled.

whatToBuy: Spiritual books or prasadam (blessed food) from the temple counters.
safetyNotes: Deposit footwear and bags at the designated counters.
photoSpots: The main temple gopuram (tower) from the outside.

dailyItinerary.optimizedRoute: Hotel City Meridian → Bannerghatta Biological Park → Lal Bagh Botanical Garden → Commercial Street → Hotel City Meridian

places.name: Bannerghatta Biological Park
places.description: A unique biological park that features a zoo, a pet corner, an animal rescue center, a butterfly enclosure, an aquarium, a snake house, and a safari park. It's a popular destination for families and wildlife enthusiasts.
places.whyVisit: It offers a comprehensive wildlife experience with its Grand Safari, where you can see animals like tigers, lions, and bears in their naturalistic habitats. The butterfly park is another key highlight.

practicalInfo.entryFee: Combo ticket (Zoo, Safari, Butterfly Park) is approx. ₹260 for adults, ₹130 for children.
practicalInfo.accessibility: Wheelchair access is available, but navigating the large area can be challenging.

whatToBring: Sunscreen, hats, and sunglasses, as the weather is expected to be sunny.
safetyNotes: Stay inside the vehicle during the safari.

places.name: Lal Bagh Botanical Garden
places.description: A nationally and internationally renowned center for botanical artwork, scientific study of plants, and conservation. The garden features a famous glass house, a lake, and one of the largest collections of tropical plants in India.
places.whyVisit: It's a horticultural treasure with a serene atmosphere. The ancient rock formation, known as the Lal Bagh Rock, is over 3000 million years old and is a major attraction.

whatToBuy: Plants and seeds from the nursery.
safetyNotes: Be careful on the rocky outcrop.
photoSpots: The Glass House (inspired by London's Crystal Palace)

places.name: Shopping at Commercial Street
places.description: One of the busiest and oldest shopping areas in Bengaluru, Commercial Street is a maze of lanes offering a wide range of goods, from clothing and accessories to electronics and home decor. It's famous for its vibrant street shopping experience.
places.whyVisit: To experience the local shopping culture, bargain for goods, and find unique souvenirs and gifts to take back home.
activities: Shopping for clothes, footwear, and jewelry

practicalInfo.accessibility: Can be crowded and challenging for wheelchair users.

whatToBring: Cash, as not all vendors accept cards.
safetyNotes: Be aware of your belongings in crowded areas.

places.name: Leisurely Breakfast & Last-minute Souvenirs
places.description: Enjoy a final, relaxed breakfast in Bengaluru. Use this time to do some last-minute souvenir shopping at nearby local markets or state emporiums like Cauvery Arts & Crafts Emporium for authentic handicrafts.
places.whyVisit: A calm start to your travel day and a final opportunity to purchase memories of your trip.
activities: Shopping for souvenirs like sandalwood carvings or silk.

whatToBuy: Sandalwood oil, Mysore silk, Channapatna toys.

places.name: Departure from Bengaluru
places.description: Check out from your hotel and head to Kempegowda International Airport (BLR) for your flight back to Delhi, carrying wonderful memories of your family trip to Bengaluru.

practicalInfo.duration: Allow at least 1.5-2 hours for travel to the airport

safetyNotes: Leave for the airport well in advance, accounting for Bengaluru's traffic.

budgetTips: Utilize ride-sharing apps like Ola or Uber for local transport, which can be cheaper than regular taxis.
Enjoy street food and meals at smaller, local eateries for an authentic and budget-friendly experience.
Book flights and accommodation well in advance to get the best prices.

clothing: A light jacket or sweater for evenings
Modest attire for temple visits (covering shoulders and knees)
medication: Basic first-aid kit (band-aids, antiseptic, pain relievers)
documents: Government-issued photo ID (Aadhaar card, driver's license)
Digital copies of all important documents

preTripChecklist.task: Book round-trip flights from Delhi to Bengaluru
Book accommodation at Hotel City Meridian
Plan daily local transport (e.g., booking a cab for the day or using ride-sharing apps)
Pack all necessary items from the packing list
Inform your bank of your travel dates to avoid card issues
Charge all electronic devices before leaving
